text: I bet on everything I can, which is every match outside ITF and exhibition, and ITF with a starting price. The only way you can bet on more matches is those ITF matches without a starting price. My stuff relies on generating probabilities per point, and you can't do that properly without a starting price (unless you generate it yourself)

elements.text: I bet on everything I can, which is every match outside ITF and exhibition, and ITF with a starting price. The only way you can bet on more matches is those ITF matches without a starting price. My stuff relies on generating probabilities per point, and you can't do that properly without a starting price (unless you generate it yourself)

text: I'm surprised that Mo bets on more matches than me - there basically isn't anything left apart from the ITF matches with no liquidity. I even bet on early ITF, which most people think is crazy (possible match fixing)

text: Can anyone confirm if <mailto:info@betfair.com|info@betfair.com> is still valid? Sent them an email but didn't get the usual automated response. text: No bet delay on passive orders....

text: that would increase uptake rates for sure

text: Also they should learn to reactivate accounts.. I got mine closed due to REST API frequency .. they reactivated but something got screwed up with the fact i am not on the main exchange.. after 1 week of back and forth with support they dedided the best way was to literally zap my account and make me wait 10 days to reopen a new one..

text: Obviously it benefits the punters but are more efficient markets good for us? The passive orders thing would make for some really easy strategies and you could see the markets smothered with money. The delay provides a barrier to entry that might be protective for winners.

text: I have been in contact with another syndicate in Sweden. My guess is that all of us calculating a price based on stats at each point will in general be on the same side.
